did.unittitle: Herbert Henry Nicke and Mabel Delia Brown Nicke photograph collection 1918
did.abstract: Photograph collection of a soldier in the U.S. 340th Ambulance Company during World War I and his future wife who served as secretary of the YMCA Michigan Hut at Conlie (Sarthe), France.

repository.corpname: Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

acqinfo.p: The collection was donated by Brett D. Brown, of Lake Worth, Florida, in 2009 (Donor No. 10269).

accruals.p: No further additions to the papers are expected.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

userestrict.p: Copyright is not held by the Regents of the University of Michigan.

prefercite.p: item, folder title, box. no., Herbert Henry Nicke and Mabel Delia Brown Nicke photograph collection, 1918, Bentley Historical Library, University of Michigan

bioghist.p: Herbert Henry Nicke served in the U.S. 340th Ambulance Company during World War I. Mabel Delia Brown served as secretary of the YMCA Michigan Hut at Conlie (Sarthe), France during the war. They were married in 1925.

scopecontent.p: Photos of the 337th and 340th Ambulance Companies and 310th Field Hospital training at Camp Custer, Mich., and of the Michigan Hut at Conlie, France.

The original papers and photographs are owned by the donor; the Bentley only holds the digital versions. The donor digitized all of the materials represented on this CD-ROM. In this finding aid, the files have been arranged into two series, Papers and Visual Materials. Within each series, files are listed numerically according to the number they were given by donor. A short description of the digitized object follows the file number. All of the files on the CD-ROM are in the tiff format.

note.p: (Also includes a brief text description of the "Michigan Hut" a the Custer Division encampment at Conlie ,France.)
